post_text:
Hi there! Today I’m excited to be joining Simon Says Stamp along with several talented designers for a Holiday Release Week blog hop!
My first card features the fabulous new Christmas Town stamp set, which was part of the Advent release.
I just love architectural images, especially for the holidays! I used the Slopes & Hills dies to make a hilly little village scene. I blended some Maliblue ink on the hills and colored the images with Copics.
I used a couple of goodies from the Holiday Card kit to make this next card.
This adorable little Retro Deer dieÂ is perfect! I cropped him off to the side of a small little ink blended panel. I stitched the small panels ontoÂ the card for something different and then added that gorgeous “joy” sticker by My Mind’s EyeÂ that is also included in the kit.
Simon Says Stamp is so generouslyÂ offering a $50 gift card to one lucky winner…WOOT!
Leave me a comment for your chance to win!

Simon Says Stamp

post_text:
Hello there! Just popping in with some fun note cards & treat boxes using the new May Card Kit by Simon Says Stamp.The Happy Days stamp set included in the kit has theÂ cutest images & sentiments perfect for making thoughtful teacher appreciation note cards.
IÂ can’t even get over the gorgeous plaid pattern papers included in the kit by Lawn Fawn. You know how I feel about plaid, right. It’s up there almost with dark chocolate in my book of things to live for.IÂ used the We R Memory Keepers Punch Board to make these cute little boxes with the plaid papers to put some chocolates in them, and I’ll have my kids send them to school for their teachers. The question it: will the chocolate still be in the box when the teacher gets it?

My kids have so many teachers that need to be appreciated. One example is my Charlie. Poor thing broke his arm yesterday. Gotta love boys and their stunts on the stairs. His sweet teacher sat down with him and helped him finishÂ his assignments as he is struggling to hold a pencil. His teacher deserves a big ol chocolate truffle…and a nap:)Such a fun, fun kit this month. Check out the Simon Says Stamp blog to see more info about this month’s kit. Thanks so much for stopping by!

post_text:
Hello! I’m back for another group post with Papertrey Ink showcasing some fabulous new products that are geared towards helping you celebrate the men in your life. The design team was challenged to take an older, more feminine card and use some of the new products to recreate it with a more masculine feel. I chose the card below, from last December’s release, as my inspiration.I used the new Text Block: Dad die with banners similar to my inspiration card but in masculine colors.
I stamped a sentiment from new Tucked In: Father’s Day on the inside of the card.

These text block dies and phrase play dies are some of my favorites to use. They make card making so quick & easy.Next up is a little gift to go along with the masculine theme.
I used the new Key Fob dies as well as the coordinating Stitched Medallion 2 dies. I used coordinating embroidery threads and kinda made some sort of design. I really had no idea what I was doing…I just went with it. I used the Gable Box die to create the packaging and embossed a sentiment from the new Keep it Simple: Father stamp set.
You don’t have to sacrifice style to create amazing masculine cards. These fun new products are just the ticket for letting the men in your life know how loved & appreciated they are in a stylish, trendy and heartfelt way.
Make sure and check out what the rest of the team has created using these new products.
Nichole • Betsy • Dawn • Heather • Melissa • Laurie • Maile • Ashley • Amy
Thanks so much for stopping by!

best dad ever card:
cardstock: stamper’s select white, simply chartreuse, ripe avocado, spring rain, blueberry sky, enchanted evening, scarlet jewel
dies: text block: dad

key fob:
dies: key fob, stitched medallion 2
felt: blueberry sky

gable box:
cardstock: simply chartreuse, blueberry sky, enchanted evening, scarlet jewel
stamps: keep it simple: father
dies: gable box

post_text:
Hello there! Today I’m very excited to be joining Simon Says Stamp for their Better Together Release hop. This release is chock full of “love” themed products that are perfect for creating valentines or even just to let someone know you care about them all year long.
I used the Tiny Hearts stencil to create my colorful background.Â by mixingÂ some white embossing paste with Distress inks. Then I added a sentiment using the Sending word die and Sending and Wishing stamp set.
Here’s a little video to show you how I created my card.

Simon Says Stamp is giving away a prize package on each stop of the hop, so leave a comment for your chance to win. Winners will be selected on January 23rd.
Your next stop on the hop is the very lovely and talentedÂ Nichol Magouirk.
Thanks so much for hopping by!

post_title: SSS-5 Ways to Give a Gift Card
post_text:
Hello again….just popping in to let you know that I have a really fun post over on the Simon Says Stamp blog today showing 5 different ways to package gift cards along with a video.
Hope you’ll check it out and give one of these gift card packaging ideas a try. Thanks so much!
